Description: An authentication permission was created/granted to an application in Microsoft Entra ID.
An application was registered in Microsoft Entra ID. An application is represented by a service principal in the directory.

Friendly name: Added credentials to a service principal
Description: Credentials were added to a service principal in Microsoft Entra ID. A service principle represents an application in the directory.
An authentication permission was removed from an application in Microsoft Entra ID.

Friendly name: Removed a service principal from the directory
Description: An application was deleted/unregistered from Microsoft Entra ID. An application is represented by a service principal in the directory.

Friendly name: Removed credentials from a service principal
Description: Credentials were removed from a service principal in Microsoft Entra ID. A service principle represents an application in the directory.
An authentication permission was updated for an application in Microsoft Entra ID.
Admin updates the organization privacy settings for Briefing email.
Admin updates the user privacy settings for Briefing email.
A communication compliance administrator has performed a policy update.
A user has sent a message that matches a policy's condition.
Tags are applied to messages or messages are resolved.
An admin changed the roles for users.
An admin changed the automation level for tenant across all actions.
An admin changed the testing source automation settings.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) created a new Copilot plugin.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) created a new promptbook in Copilot.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) deleted a Copilot plugin.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) deleted a Copilot promptbook.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) disabled a Copilot plugin.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) disabled a Copilot promptbook.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) enabled a Copilot plugin.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) enabled a Copilot promptbook.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) entered prompts in Copilot.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) updated a Copilot plugin setting.
A user (or admin or system on behalf of a user) updated a Copilot promptbook setting.
An admin (or system on behalf of an admin) updated a Copilot setting.
An admin (or a user who's a member of the Content Explorer Content Viewer role group) uses content explorer to view an email message or SharePoint/OneDrive document.
Added a domain to your organization.

Friendly name: Added a partner to the directory
Description: Added a partner (delegated administrator) to your organization.
Removed a domain from your organization.

Friendly name: Removed a partner from the directory
Description: Removed a partner (delegated administrator) from your organization.
Updated the company information for your organization. Includes email addresses for subscription-related email sent by Microsoft 365, and technical notifications about Microsoft 365 services.
Changed the domain authentication setting for your organization.

Friendly name: Updated the federation settings for a domain
Description: Changed the federation (external sharing) settings for your organization.
Changed the length and character constraints for user passwords in your organization.
Set the property that enables a directory for Azure AD Sync.
Updated the settings of a domain in your organization.
Verified that your organization is the owner of a domain.
Used email verification to verify that your organization is the owner of a domain.

For manual approval: A disposition reviewer approved the disposition of the item to move it to the next disposition stage. If the item was in the only or final stage of disposition review, the disposition approval marked the item as eligible for permanent deletion.  For autoapproval: No manual action was taken within the configured autoapproval time period so the item automatically moved to the next disposition stage. If the item was in the only or final stage of disposition review, the item automatically became eligible for permanent deletion.
A disposition reviewer extended the retention period of the item.
A disposition reviewer relabeled the retention label.
A disposition reviewer added one or more other users to the current disposition review stage.
Corresponding cmdlet
Add-ComplianceCaseMember
Set-ComplianceSearch

Set-ComplianceSecurityFilter

Friendly name: Changed search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: Set-CaseHoldRule
N/A

Friendly name: Created search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: New-CaseHoldRule
Remove-ComplianceSearch
Remove-eDiscoveryCaseAdmin
Remove-ComplianceCase
Remove-ComplianceSecurityFilter

Friendly name: Deleted search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: Remove-CaseHoldRule
N/A

Remove-ComplianceSearchAction
Remove-ComplianceSearchAction
Remove-ComplianceCaseMember

Friendly name: Removed preview results of content search
Description: Remove-ComplianceSearchAction

Description: Remove-ComplianceSearchAction
Remove-ComplianceSearchAction
New-ComplianceSearchAction

New-ComplianceSearchAction

Get-ComplianceCase
Get-ComplianceSearch
Get-ComplianceSearchAction -Export

Description

Friendly name: Added data to another review set
Description: User added documents from one review set to a different review set.
User added the search results from a content search associated with an eDiscovery (Premium) case to a review set.

Friendly name: Added non-Microsoft 365 data to review set
Description: User added non-Microsoft 365 data to a review set.

Friendly name: Added remediated documents to review set
Description: User uploads documents that had indexing errors that were fixed to a review set.
User ran  analytics on the  documents in a review set.
User annotated a document in a review set. Annotation includes redacting content in a document.
User compared two different load sets in a review set. A load set is when data from a content search that associated with the case is added to a review set.
User converted all the redacted documents in a review set to PDF files.
User created a review set.
User created a search query that searches the documents in a review set.
User created a tag group in a review set. A tag group can contain one or more child tags. These tags are then used to tag documents in the review set.
User deleted a search query in a review set.
User deleted a tag or a tag group in a review set.
User downloaded a document from a review set.
User changed a tag in a review set.
User exported documents from a review set.
User modified the settings for a case. Case settings include case information, access permissions, and settings that control search and analytics behavior.
User edited a search query in a review set.
User previewed the results of a search query in a review set.
User fixes files that contained indexing errors.
User tags a document in a review set.
User tags all of the documents that match the criteria of search query in a review set.
User viewed a document in a review set.
Description
A hold was created for an eDiscovery case. A hold can be created with or without specifying a content source. If content sources are specified, they're identified in the audit log entry.

A hold that is associated with an eDiscovery case was deleted. Deleting a hold releases all of the content locations from the hold. Deleting the hold also results in deleting the case hold rules associated with the hold (see Remove-CaseHoldRule).
A hold that is associated with an eDiscovery was changed. Possible changes include adding or removing content locations or turning off (disabling) the hold.

Friendly name: Created search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: A query-based hold associated with an eDiscovery case was created.

Friendly name: Deleted search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: A query-based hold associated with an eDiscovery case was deleted. Removing the query from the hold is often the result of deleting a hold. When a hold or a hold query is deleted, the content locations that were on hold are released.

Friendly name: Changed search query for eDiscovery case hold
Description: A query-based hold associated with an eDiscovery case was changed. Possible changes include editing the query or date range for a query-based hold.

An eDiscovery case was created. When a case is created, you only have to give it a name. Other case-related tasks such as adding members, creating holds, and creating content searches associated with the case result in additional events being logged.
An eDiscovery case was deleted. Any hold associated with the case has to be removed before the case can be deleted.
An eDiscovery case was changed. Changes include closing an open case or reopening a closed case.
A user was added as a member of an eDiscovery case. As a member of a case, a user can perform various case-related tasks depending on whether they've been assigned the necessary permissions.
A user was removed as a member of an eDiscovery case.

The membership list of an eDiscovery case was changed. This activity is logged when all members are replaced with a group of new users. If a single member is added or removed, the Add-ComplianceCaseMember or Remove-ComplianceCaseMember operation is logged.
A new content search was created.
An existing content search was deleted.
An existing content search was changed. Changes can include adding or removing content locations that are searched and editing the search query.

A content search was started. When you create or change a content search by using the compliance portal GUI, the search is automatically started. If you create or change a search by using the New-ComplianceSearch or Set-ComplianceSearch cmdlet, you have to run the Start-ComplianceSearch cmdlet to start the search.
A content search that was running was stopped.

A content search action was created. Content search actions include previewing search results, exporting search results, preparing search results for analysis in eDiscovery (Premium), and permanently deleting items that match the search criteria of a content search.
A content search action was deleted.
A search permissions filter was created.
A search permissions filter was deleted.
A search permissions filter was changed.
A user was added as an eDiscovery Administrator in your organization.
An eDiscovery Administrator was deleted from your organization.

The list of eDiscovery Administrators in your organization was changed. This activity is logged when the list of eDiscovery Administrators is replaced with a group of new users. If a single user is added or removed, the Add-eDiscoveryCaseAdmin or Remove-eDiscoveryCaseAdmin operation is logged.

This activity is logged when a user viewed a list of eDiscovery (Standard) or eDiscovery (Premium) cases. This activity is also logged when a user views a specific case in eDiscovery (Standard). When a user views a specific case, the audit record includes the identity of the case that was viewed. If the user only viewed a list of cases, the audit record doesn't contain a case identity.

This activity is logged when a user viewed a list of Content searches or searches associated with an eDiscovery (Standard) case. This activity is also logged when a user views a specific Content search or views a specific search associated with an eDiscovery (Standard) case. When a user views a specific search, the audit record includes the identity of the search that was viewed. If the user only viewed a list of searches, the audit record doesn't contain a search identity.

This activity is logged when a user viewed a list of compliance search actions (such as exports, previews, or purges) or actions associated with an eDiscovery (Standard) case. This activity is also logged when a user views a specific compliance search action (such as an export) or views a specific action associated with an eDiscovery (Standard) case. When a user views a search action, the audit record includes the identity of the search action that was viewed. If the user only viewed a list of actions, the audit record doesn't contain an action identity.

Operation: The identity (GUID) of the eDiscovery case that was created, changed, or deleted.
eDiscovery cmdlet activities have a value of EMC for this property. This indicates the activity was performed by using the compliance portal GUI or running the cmdlet in PowerShell.
The IP address of the device that was used when the activity was logged. The IP address is displayed in either an IPv4 or IPv6 address format.
For eDiscovery activities, this property is typically blank.
The build number for the version of the compliance portal running in your organization.
The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the eDiscovery activity was completed.
The name of the Microsoft  365 organization.
The Exchange Online mailboxes that are included in a content search or placed on hold in an eDiscovery case.
Mailbox or site locations that are excluded from a content search or a hold in an eDiscovery case.

Additional properties from a content search, a content search action, or hold in an eDiscovery case, such as the object GUID and the corresponding cmdlet and cmdlet parameters that were used when the activity was performed.
The ID of the report entry. The ID uniquely identifies the audit log entry.

A list of the parameters (without any values) that were used with the cmdlet identified in the Operation property. The parameters listed in this property are the same as those listed in the Parameters property.

The GUID or name of the object (for example, a Content search or an eDiscovery (Standard) case) that was created, accessed, changed, or deleted by the activity listed in the Operation property. This object is also identified in the Item column in the audit log search results.
The type of eDiscovery object that the user created, deleted, or modified; for example, a content search action (preview, export, or purge), an eDiscovery case, or a content search.
The name of the operation that corresponds to the eDiscovery activity that was performed.
The GUID for your Microsoft 365 organization.
The name and value for the parameters that were used with the corresponding cmdlet.
The public folder locations in Exchange Online that are included in a content search or placed on hold in an eDiscovery case.
The search query associated with the activity, such as a content search or a query-based hold.

The type of operation indicated by the record. The value of 18 indicates an event related to an activity listed in the eDiscovery cmdlet activities section. A value of 24 indicates an event related to an activity listed in the eDiscovery activities section.
Indicates whether the action (specified in the Operation property) was successful or not.
Indicates that the activity was a compliance portal event. All eDiscovery activities have a value of 0 for this property.
The SharePoint Online sites that are included in a content search or placed on hold in an eDiscovery case.
The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the eDiscovery activity was started.

The user who performed the activity (specified in the Operation property) that resulted in the record being logged. Records for eDiscovery activity performed by system accounts (such as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM) are also included in the audit log.
An alternative ID for the user identified in the UserId property. For eDiscovery activities, the value for this property is typically the same as the UserId property.
The  subscription used by your organization. For eDiscovery activities, this property is typically blank.

The type of user that performed the operation. The following values indicate the user type.   0   A regular user. 2   An administrator in your organization. 3   A Microsoft datacenter administrator or datacenter system account. 4   A system account. 5   An application. 6   A service principal.
Indicates the version number of the activity (identified by the Operation property) that's logged.
The service where the activity occurred. For eDiscovery activities, the value is SecurityComplianceCenter.

Description: Description

Messages were read or accessed in mailbox. Audit records for this activity are triggered in one of two ways: when a mail client (such as Outlook) performs a bind operation on messages or when mail protocols (such as Exchange ActiveSync or IMAP) sync items in a mail folder. Analyzing audit records for this activity is useful when investigating compromised email account.

An administrator assigned the FullAccess mailbox permission to a user (known as a delegate) to another person's mailbox. The FullAccess permission allows the delegate to open the other person's mailbox, and read and manage the contents of the mailbox. The audit record for this activity is also generated when a system account in the Microsoft 365 service periodically performs maintenance tasks in behalf of your organization. A common task performed by a system account is updating the permissions for system mailboxes. For more information, see System accounts in Exchange mailbox audit records.

Friendly name: Added or removed user with delegate access to calendar folder
Description: A user was added or removed as a delegate to the calendar of another user's mailbox. Calendar delegation gives someone else in the same organization permissions to manage the mailbox owner's calendar.
A folder permission was added. Folder permissions control which users in your organization can access folders in a mailbox and the messages located in those folders.
A message was copied to another folder.

An item is created in the Calendar, Contacts, Notes, or Tasks folder in the mailbox. For example, a new meeting request is created. Creating, sending, or receiving a message isn't audited. Also, creating a mailbox folder isn't audited.

Friendly name: Created new inbox rule in Outlook web app
Description: A mailbox owner or other user with access to the mailbox created an inbox rule in the Outlook web app.

Friendly name: Deleted messages from Deleted Items folder
Description: A message was permanently deleted or deleted from the Deleted Items folder. These items are moved to the Recoverable Items folder. Messages are also moved to the Recoverable Items folder when a user selects it and presses Shift+Delete.
A message was classified as a record. Occurs when a retention label that classifies content as a record is manually or automatically applied to a message.
A message was moved to another folder.

Friendly name: Moved messages to Deleted Items folder
Description: A message was deleted and moved to the Deleted Items folder.
A folder permission was changed. Folder permissions control which users in your organization can access mailbox folders and the messages in the folder.

Friendly name: Modified inbox rule from Outlook web app
Description: A mailbox owner or other user with access to the mailbox modified an inbox rule using the Outlook web app.
A message was purged from the Recoverable Items folder (permanently deleted from the mailbox).

An administrator removed the FullAccess permission (that was assigned to a delegate) from a person's mailbox. After the FullAccess permission is removed, the delegate can't open the other person's mailbox or access any content in it.
A folder permission was removed. Folder permissions control which users in your organization can access folders in a mailbox and the messages located in those folders.
A message was sent, replied to or forwarded.

Friendly name: Sent message using Send As permissions
Description: A message was sent using the SendAs permission. This means that another user sent the message as though it came from the mailbox owner.

Friendly name: Sent message using Send On Behalf permissions
Description: A message was sent using the SendOnBehalf permission. This means that another user sent the message on behalf of the mailbox owner. The message indicates to the recipient whom the message was sent on behalf of and who actually sent the message.

Friendly name: Updated inbox rules from Outlook client
Description: A mailbox owner or other user with access to the mailbox created, modified, or removed an inbox rule by using the Outlook client.
A message or its properties was changed.
The user signed in to their mailbox.
A user applied a retention label to an email message and that label is configured to mark the item as a record.
Description
User or system account accesses a file. Once a user accesses a file, the FileAccessed event isn't logged again for the same user for same file for the next five minutes.

This is related to the "Accessed file" (FileAccessed) activity. A FileAccessedExtended event is logged when the same person continually accesses a file for an extended period (up to 3 hours).  The purpose of logging FileAccessedExtended events is to reduce the number of FileAccessed events that are logged when a file is continually accessed. This helps reduce the noise of multiple FileAccessed records for what is essentially the same user activity, and lets you focus on the initial (and more important) FileAccessed event.

Friendly name: Changed retention label for a file
Description: A retention label was applied to or removed from a document. This event is triggered when a retention label is manually or automatically applied to a message.

The record status of a retention label that classifies a document as a record was locked. This means the document can't be modified or deleted. Only users assigned at least the contributor permission for a site can change the record status of a document.

The record status of a retention label that classifies a document as a record was unlocked. This means that the document can be modified or deleted. Only users assigned at least the contributor permission for a site can change the record status of a document.
User checks in a document that they checked out from a document library.
User checks out a document located in a document library. Users can check out and make changes to documents that have been shared with them.
User copies a document from a site. The copied file can be saved to another folder on the site.
User deletes a document from a site.
User deletes a file from the recycle bin of a site.

Friendly name: Deleted file from second-stage recycle bin
Description: User deletes a file from the second-stage recycle bin of a site.

Friendly name: Deleted file marked as a record
Description: A document or email that was marked as a record was deleted. An item is considered a record when a retention label that marks items as a record is applied to content.

User uploads a document to a site that's protected with a sensitivity label and the document has a higher priority sensitivity label than the sensitivity label applied to the site. For example, a document labeled Confidential is uploaded to a site labeled General.  This event isn't triggered if the document has a lower priority sensitivity label than the sensitivity label applied to the site. For example, a document labeled General is uploaded to a site labeled Confidential. For more information about sensitivity label priority, see Label priority (order matters).
SharePoint anti-virus engine detects malware in a file.
User discards (or undoes) a checked out file. That means any changes they made to the file when it was checked out are discarded, and not saved to the version of the document in the document library.
User downloads a document from a site.

User or system account modifies the content or the properties of a document on a site. The system waits five minutes before it logs another FileModified event when the same user modifies the content or properties of the same document.

This is related to the "Modified file" (FileModified) activity. A FileModifiedExtended event is logged when the same person continually modifies a file for an extended period (up to 3 hours).  The purpose of logging FileModifiedExtended events is to reduce the number of FileModified events that are logged when a file is continually modified. This helps reduce the noise of multiple FileModified records for what is essentially the same user activity, and lets you focus on the initial (and more important) FileModified event.
User moves a document from its current location on a site to a new location.
User previews files on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. These events typically occur in high volumes based on a single activity, such as viewing an image gallery.

User or system account performs a search in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business. Some common scenarios where a service account performs a search query include applying an eDiscovery holds and retention policy to sites and OneDrive accounts, and autoapplying retention or sensitivity labels to site content. To enable logging for this activity, see Get started with auditing solutions.
User moves a file into the SharePoint Recycle Bin.
User moves a folder into the SharePoint Recycle Bin.

Friendly name: Recycled all minor versions of file
Description: User deletes all minor versions from the version history of a file. The deleted versions are moved to the site's recycle bin.
User deletes all versions from the version history of a file. The deleted versions are moved to the site's recycle bin.
User deletes a version from the version history of a file. The deleted version is moved to the site's recycle bin.
User renames a document.
User restores a document from the recycle bin of a site.
User uploads a document to a folder on a site.

User views a page on a site. This doesn't include using a Web browser to view files located in a document library. Once a user views a page, the PageViewed event isn't logged again for the same user for same page for the next five minutes.

This is related to the "Viewed page" (PageViewed) activity. A PageViewedExtended event is logged when the same person continually views a web page for an extended period (up to 3 hours).  The purpose of logging PageViewedExtended events is to reduce the number of PageViewed events that are logged when a page is continually viewed. This helps reduce the noise of multiple PageViewed records for what is essentially the same user activity, and lets you focus on the initial (and more important) PageViewed event.

A user's client (such as website or mobile app) has signaled that the indicated page has been viewed by the user. This activity is often logged following a PagePrefetched event for a page. NOTE: Because ClientViewSignaled events are signaled by the client, rather than the server, it's possible the event may not be logged by the server and therefore may not appear in the audit log. It's also possible that information in the audit record may not be trustworthy. However, because the user's identity is validated by the token used to create the signal, the user's identity listed in the corresponding audit record is accurate. The system waits five minutes before it logs the same event when the same user's client signals that the page has been viewed again by the user.

A user's client (such as website or mobile app) has requested the indicated page to help improve performance if the user browses to it. This event is logged to indicate that the page content has been served to the user's client. This event isn't a definitive indication that the user navigated to the page.  When the page content is rendered by the client (as per the user's request) a ClientViewSignaled event should be generated. Not all clients support indicating a prefetch, and therefore some prefetched activities might instead be logged as PageViewed events.
Description
User copies a folder from a site to another location in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business.
User creates a folder on a site.
User deletes a folder from a site.
User deletes a folder from the recycle bin on a site.

Friendly name: Deleted folder from second-stage recycle bin
Description: User deletes a folder from the second-stage recycle bin on a site.
User modifies a folder on a site. This includes changing the folder metadata, such as changing tags and properties.
User moves a folder to a different location on a site.
User renames a folder on a site.
User restores a deleted folder from the recycle bin on a site.
Description

Friendly name: Changed AppBypassInformationBarrier setting for the tenant
Description: A SharePoint or global administrator has changed apps access for SharePoint sites.

Friendly name: Applied information barrier mode to site
Description: A SharePoint or global administrator has applied a mode to the site.
A SharePoint, global administrator, or site owner added one or more information barriers segments to a site.

Friendly name: Changed information barrier mode of site
Description: A SharePoint or global administrator has updated the mode of the site.
A SharePoint or global administrator changed one or more information barriers segments for a site.

Friendly name: Disabled information barriers for SharePoint and OneDrive
Description: A SharePoint or global administrator has disabled information barriers for SharePoint and OneDrive in the organization.

Friendly name: Enabled information barriers for SharePoint and OneDrive
Description: A SharePoint or global administrator has disabled information barriers for SharePoint and OneDrive in the organization.
System completes build of the information barriers insights report.

Friendly name: Information barriers insights report OneDrive section queried
Description: An administrator queries the information barriers insights report for OneDrive accounts.
An administrator schedules the information barriers insights report.

Friendly name: Information barriers insights report SharePoint section queried
Description: An administrator queries the information barriers insights report for Sharepoint sites.
A SharePoint or global administrator removed one or more information barriers segments from a site.
Description
An action for a device managed by Cloud Update has been triggered. This includes triggering a rollback, resuming a rolled back device, or changing the update channel.
A Cloud Update profile's configuration has changed. This includes changes to the profile's state, set deadline, Update Validation enablement, and configured waves and wave delay.
The Cloud Update's tenant-wide configuration has changed. This includes changing exclusions, exclusion windows, and generating a new Tenant Association Key (TAK).
Description
A new policy configuration was created.
A policy configuration was deleted.
An existing policy configuration was updated, for example by adding, changing, or removing policy settings, or by changing the policy configuration's name, description, or scope.
The priority of a policy configuration was changed.
Description
A Microsoft 365 Backup policy is activated from an inactive state.
A draft restore task for Microsoft 365 Backup is activated. It is a long running operation.
One or more backup items are added to a Microsoft 365 Backup policy.
One or more backup items is/are removed from a Microsoft 365 Backup policy.
A restore task is completed in Microsoft 365 Backup.
A restore task is created in Microsoft 365 Backup. By default, the restore task is created as draft.
A new Microsoft 365 Backup policy has been created by a Global Admin. By default, a backup policy is created in an inactive state.
A Microsoft 365 Backup policy is deleted.
A draft restore task is deleted in Microsoft 365 Backup.

A Microsoft 365 Backup policy is updated. Backup policies are updated by any of the following actions: 1. Renaming the policy.2. Add one or more protection units.3. Removing one or more protection units.
A draft restore task is edited in Microsoft 365 Backup.
A Microsoft 365 Backup policy is paused from active state.
User requests the protection unit backed up using Microsoft 365 Backup programmatically.

Friendly name: Programmatically got Details of Backup Policy
Description: Details of a Microsoft 365 Backup policy are accessed programmatically.

Friendly name: Programmatically got Details of Restore Task
Description: A user  requests details of restore task by its identifier in Microsoft 365 Backup.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of all Backup Policies
Description: A user programmatically gets the list of all backup policies backed up using Microsoft 365 Backup.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Backup Items in Backup Policies
Description: A list of all protection units present in a backup policy in Microsoft 365 Backup is requested programmatically.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Backup Items in Tenant
Description: A user programmatically gets list of all protection units in the organization backed up using Microsoft 365 Backup.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Backup Items in Workload
Description: A user programmatically gets list of all protection units in workload (SharePoint, OneDrive, or Exchange) backed up using Microsoft 365 Backup.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Restore Items in Restore Task
Description: A user programmatically gets all artifacts in a restore task in Microsoft 365 Backup.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Restore Points
Description: A user programmatically gets all restore points in Microsoft 365 Backup. Restore Points represent the timestamp when an artifact is protected (per Protection Policy). Only Global Admins have access.

Friendly name: Programmatically got list of Restore Tasks
Description: A user programmatically gets the list of existing restore sessions in Microsoft 365 Backup. This includes the restore session created for every service type enrolled in the organization.
The restoration of an item backed up by Microsoft 365 Backup is completed.
Restore is triggered for an item backed up with Microsoft 365 Backup.
Description
Downloaded the package used to remove devices from Defender for Endpoint.
Downloaded the package used to onboard devices to Defender for Endpoint.
Edited the data retention settings for Defender for Endpoint.

Changed advanced features in Defender for Endpoint, enabling more precise controls during an incident. Only settings for advanced features that are generally available are logged in the Microsoft 365 audit log.
Description
Created a new Indicator of compromise you can use to track attacks and events.
Edited an Indicator of compromise.
Removed an Indicator of compromise.
Description
Collected information about a device that's used to understand attack tools and techniques.
Ran Microsoft Defender Antivirus scan on a device.
Prevent a malicious app from running.
Allow an app to run.
Isolated a device from the network, helping prevent attacks from spreading.
Added an isolated device back onto the network.
Quarantined a suspicious file for further analysis.
Downloaded a suspicious file for further investigation.
Removed a device from Defender for Endpoint.
Opened a Live response session via an API call, opening a remote shell into a device.
Collected log information about Defender for Endpoint.

Friendly name: Ran get Live response file link
Description: Opened a Live response session, opening a remote shell into a device.
Ran a Live response session, opening a remote shell into a device.
Description
Added new security role and permissions.
Edited security roles and permissions.
Removed security roles and permissions.
Description
An administrator granted one or more role permissions to Defender Experts analysts to investigate incidents or remediate threats.
An administrator modified role permissions for Defender Experts analysts to investigate incidents or remediate threats.
Description
A tag was added or removed from an entity.
A global exclusion was added for an alert or for an entity.
A global exclusion was updated for an alert or for an entity.
A global exclusion was deleted for an alert or for an entity.
The alerts thresholds configuration was updated.
The detailed Excel file of an alert was downloaded.
A remediation action was added to the queue.
A remediation action was completed.
A sensor's configuration was updated.
A new sensor was added.
A sensor was deleted.
The sensors access key was retrieved.
The sensors access key was regenerated.
The sensors activation mode was modified.
The Domain Controller coverage Excel file was downloaded.
The Directory services accounts set was modified.
The Manage action accounts set was modified.
The Manage action accounts mode was modified.
A health issue was modified.
A report was downloaded.
A report's scheduling was modified.
The syslog forwarding configuration was modified.
The security alerts or health issues notifications configuration was modified.
A recipient was added to the security alerts notification configuration.
A recipient was removed from the security alerts notification configuration.
A recipient was added to the health issues notification configuration.
A recipient was removed from the heath issues notification configuration.

The workspace was created.
The workspace was deleted.
Description
A new custom detection rule was created.
A custom detection rule was modified.
A custom detection rule was turned off or on.
A custom detection rule was manually run.
A custom detection rule was removed.
Description
Added comment to incident.
Assigned user to incident.
Unassigned user to incident.
Updated incidents status.
Edit incident classification.
Added tags to incident.
Removed tags from incident.
Description
Created alert suppression rule.
Deleted alert suppression rule.
Enabled alert suppression rule.
Disabled alert suppression rule.
Deleted alert suppression rule.
Description
A group was created.
A member was added to a group.
A group was deleted.
A member was removed from a group.
A property of a group was changed.
Description
Form owner adds comment or score to a quiz.

Form owner creates a new form. Property DataMode:string indicates the current form is set to sync with a new or existing Excel workbook if the property value equals DataSync. Property ExcelWorkbookLink:string indicates the associated Excel workbook ID of the current form.

Form owner edits a form such as creating, removing, or editing a question. The property EditOperation:string indicates the edit operation name. The possible operations are:- CreateQuestion- CreateQuestionChoice - DeleteQuestion - DeleteQuestionChoice - DeleteFormImage - DeleteQuestionImage - UpdateQuestion - UpdateQuestionChoice - UploadFormImage/Bing/Onedrive - UploadQuestionImage - ChangeTheme FormImage includes any place within Forms that user can upload an image, such as in a query or as a background theme.

Form owner moves a form. Property DestinationUserId:string indicates the user ID of the person who moved the form. Property NewFormId:string is the new ID for the newly copied form. Property IsDelegateAccess:boolean indicates the current form move action is performed through the admin delegate page.
Form owner deletes a form. This includes SoftDelete (delete option used and form moved to recycle bin) and HardDelete (Recycle bin is emptied).

Form owner opens an existing form for editing. Property AccessDenied:boolean indicates access of current form is denied due to permission check. Property FromSummaryLink:boolean indicates current request comes from the summary link page.
Form owner previews a form using the Preview function.
Form owner exports results to Excel. Property ExportFormat:string indicates if the Excel file is Download or Online.
Form owner creates a template link to share the form with other users. This event is logged when the form owner selects to generate template URL.
Form owner deletes template link.
A user uses a collaboration link to help design for/view responses. This event is logged when a user uses a collab URL (not when collab URL is first generated).
Form owner deletes a collaboration link.
User has opened a response page to view. This event is logged regardless of whether the user submits a response or not.

Similar to receiving a new response. A user has submitted a response to a form. Property ResponseId:string and Property ResponderId:string indicates which result is being viewed. For an anonymous responder, the ResponderId property is null.

Form owner has updated a comment or score on a quiz. Property ResponseId:string and Property ResponderId:string indicates which result is being viewed. For an anonymous responder, the ResponderId property is null.
Form owner deletes all response data.
Form owner deletes one response. Property ResponseId:string indicates the response being deleted.
Form owner views the aggregated list of responses. Property ViewType:string indicates whether form owner is viewing Detail or Aggregate

Form owner views a particular response. Property ResponseId:string and Property ResponderId:string indicates which result is being viewed. For an anonymous responder, the ResponderId property is null.
Form owner creates summary results link to share results.
Form owner deletes summary results link.

This event is logged whenever the detailed value for the internal security status was changed, regardless of whether this changed the final security state (for example, form is now Closed or Opened). This means you may see duplicate events without a final security state change. The possible status values for this event are:- Take Down - Take Down by Admin - Admin Unblocked - Auto Blocked - Auto Unblocked - Customer Reported - Reset Customer Reported

This event is logged whenever the value for the user security status was changed. The value of the user status in the audit record is Confirmed as Phisher when the user created a phishing form that was taken down by the Microsoft Online safety team. If an admin unblocks the user, the value of the user's status is set to Reset as Normal User.
User selects to activate a Pro trial.

Form owner updates one or multiple form settings. Property FormSettingName:string indicates updated sensitive settings' name. Property NewFormSettings:string indicates updated settings' name and new value. Property thankYouMessageContainsLink:boolean indicates updated thank-you message contains a URL link.
Form owner updates a user setting. Property UserSettingName:string indicates the setting's name and new value
Form owner is viewing a list of forms. Property ViewType:string indicates which view the form owner is looking at: All Forms, Shared with Me, or Group Forms
A user submits a response to a form. Property IsInternalForm:boolean indicates if the responder is within the same organization as the form owner.
Form owner turns on the setting allowing any one to respond to the form.
Form owner turns off the setting allowing any one to respond to the form.

Friendly name: Enabled specific people can respond setting
Description: Form owner turns on the setting allowing only specific people or specific groups in the current organization to respond to the form.

Friendly name: Disabled specific people can respond setting
Description: Form owner turns off the setting allowing only specific people or specific groups in the current organization to respond to the form.
Form owner adds a new user or group to the specific responders list.
Form owner removes a user or group from the specific responders list.
Form owner turns off the setting of collaboration on the form.

Friendly name: Enabled Office 365 work or school account collaboration
Description: Form owner turns on the setting allowing users with a Microsoft 365 work or school account to view and edit the form.

Friendly name: Enabled people in my organization collaboration
Description: Form owner turns on the setting allowing users in the current organization to view and edit the form.
Form owner turns on the setting allowing only specific people or specific groups in the current organization to view and edit the form.
Connected the form to an Excel workbook. Property ExcelWorkbookLink:string indicates the associated Excel workbook ID of the current form.
Form owner created a collection.
Form owner updated a collection property.

Friendly name: Deleted collection from the Recycle Bin
Description: Form owner hard-deleted a collection from the Recycle Bin.

Friendly name: Moved collection to the Recycle Bin
Description: Form owner moved a collection to the Recycle Bin.
Form owner changed the name of a collection.
Form owner moved a form into a collection.

Friendly name: Moved a form out of collection
Description: Form owner moved a form out of a collection.
User ID that's logged
UPN
UPN
urn:forms:coauthor#a0b1c2d3@forms.office.com(The second part of the ID is a hash, which will differ for different users)
UPN
urn:forms:external#a0b1c2d3@forms.office.com(The second part of the User ID is a hash, which will differ for different users)
urn:forms:anonymous#a0b1c2d3@forms.office.com(The second part of the User ID is a hash, which will differ for different users)
Description
A user performed a consent modification request.
A user performed an extraction. Partner datasets and ISV runs are excluded.
Description
A plan is read by a user or an app. If the read operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, ContainerType indicates ContainerType.Invalid and ContainerId indicates null.

A plan is created by a user or an app. If the create operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, ObjectId indicates null, ContainerType indicates ContainerType.Invalid and ContainerId indicates null.
A plan is modified by a user or an app.
A plan is deleted by a user or an app.

A plan is copied by a user or an app. If the copy operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.Failure, newPlanId indicates null, newContainerType indicates ContainerType.Invalid, and newContainerId indicates null.
A task is read by a user or an app. If the read operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, PlanId indicates null.
A task is created by a user or an app. If the create operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, ObjectId indicates null and PlanId indicates null.
A task is modified by a user or an app.
A task is deleted by a user or an app.
A task's assignee is modified by a user or an app. This can be an unassigned task getting assigned or an assigned task has a new assignee.
A task is marked completed by a user or an app.
A roster is created by a user or an app. If the create operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, ObjectId indicates null, MemberIds indicates an empty string.
A roster is deleted by a user or an app.

Friendly name: Added a member(s) to a roster
Description: A member(s) is added to a roster. If the add operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, MemberIds indicates the list of member IDs attempted.

Friendly name: Removed a member(s) to a roster
Description: A member(s) is removed from a roster. If the remove operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, MemberIds indicates the list of member IDs attempted.
A list of plans is queried by a user or an app. If the query operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, PlanList indicates an empty string.
A list of tasks is queried by a user or an app. If the query operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, TaskList indicates an empty string.

Tenant settings are updated by a tenant admin. If the update operation is a ResultStatus.Failure or ResultStatus.AuthorizationFailure, ObjectId indicates the original settings, and TenantSettings indicates the tenant settings attempted.
A user or an app updates a roster's sensitivity label.
Description
A project is created by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio is created by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio item is created by a user or app.
A task is created by a user or app.
A project is deleted by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio is deleted by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio item is deleted by a user or app.
A task is deleted by a user or app.
A project is read or app.
A list of projects and/or roadmaps is queried by a user.
A roadmap or portfolio is read by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio item is read by a user or app.
A task is read by a user or app.
Project settings are updated by an admin.
A roadmap or portfolio is modified by a user or app.
A roadmap or portfolio item is modified by a user or app.
Roadmap or portfolio settings are updated by an admin.
A task is modified by a user or app.
A project is modified by a user or app.
Description
A new audit search request is submitted.
An audit search job is completed.
An audit search job is canceled.
An audit search job is deleted.
An export job is created to export the search results of an audit search query.
The export job to export the search results of an audit search query is completed.
The search results from an audit search query were downloaded.
Description
A new asset or entity is created or added to an existing asset.
Add classifications to asset entity.
Create a classification type.
Delete a classification type.
Update a classification type.
Delete classifications from asset entity.
Update classifications on asset entity.
An asset or entity is deleted from an existing asset.
Includes: attribute update, business attribute update, collection info (only include collection ID), contacts update, customAttributes, hierarchy, homeId, labels, sourceDetails
Assign terms to asset entity.
Create a term.
Delete a term.
Disassociate terms from asset entity.
Update a term.
Sensitivity label is added/updated/deleted.
Description
A user adds a bot to a team.
A user adds a channel to a team.
A user adds a connector to a channel.
Teams added information about a meeting, including the start time, the end time, and the URL to join the meeting.
Teams added information about the participants of a meeting, including the user ID of each participant, the time a participant joined the meeting, and the time a participant left the meeting.
A team owner adds members to a team, channel, or group chat.
A user adds a tab to a channel.
A user or meeting organizer applied a sensitivity label to a Teams meeting.

The ChannelSettingChanged operation is logged when the following activities are performed by a team member. For each of these activities, a description of the setting that was changed (shown in parentheses) is displayed in the Item column in the audit log search results. Changes name of a team channel (Channel name)Changes description of a team channel (Channel description)

The TeamsTenantSettingChanged operation is logged when the following activities are performed by a global admin in the Microsoft 365 admin center. These activities affect org-wide Teams settings. To learn more, see Manage Teams settings for your organization. For each of these activities, a description of the setting that was changed (shown in parentheses) is displayed in the Item column in the audit log search results.Enables or disables Teams for the organization (Microsoft Teams).Enables or disables interoperability between Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business for the organization (Skype for Business interoperability).Enables or disables the organizational chart view in Microsoft Teams clients (Org chart view).Enables or disables the ability for team members to schedule private meetings (Private meeting scheduling).Enables or disables the ability for team members to schedule channel meetings (Channel meeting scheduling).Enables or disables video calling in Teams meetings (Video for Skype meetings).Enables or disables screen sharing in Microsoft Teams meetups for the organization (Screen sharing for Skype meetings).Enables or disables that ability to add animated images (called Giphys) to Teams conversations (Animated images).Changes the content rating setting for the organization (Content rating). The content rating restricts the type of animated image that can be displayed in conversations.Enables or disables the ability for team members to add customizable images (called custom memes) from the internet to team conversations (Customizable images from the Internet).Enables or disables the ability for team members to add editable images (called stickers) to team conversations (Editable images).Enables or disables that ability for team members to use bots in Microsoft Teams chats and channels (Org-wide bots).Enables specific bots for Microsoft Teams. This doesn't include the T-Bot, which is Teams help bot that's available when bots are enabled for the organization (Individual bots).Enables or disables the ability for team members to add extensions or tabs (Extensions or tabs).Enables or disables the side-loading of proprietary bots for Microsoft Teams (Side loading of Bots).Enables or disables the ability for users to send email messages to a Microsoft Teams channel (Channel email).

Friendly name: Changed role of members in team
Description: A team owner changes the role of members in a team. The following values indicate the role type assigned to the user. 1 - Indicates the Member role.2 - Indicates the Owner role.3 - Indicates the Guest role.The Members property also includes the name of your organization and the member's email address.

The TeamSettingChanged operation is logged when the following activities are performed by a team owner. For each of these activities, a description of the setting that was changed (shown in parentheses) is displayed in the Item column in the audit log search results.Changes the access type for a team. Teams can be set as private or public (Team access type). When a team is private (the default setting), users can access the team only by invitation. When a team is public, it's discoverable by anyone.Changes the information classification of a team (Team classification). For example, team data can be classified as high business impact, medium business impact, or low business impact.Changes the name of a team (Team name).Changes the team description (Team description).Changes made to team settings. To access these settings, a team owner can right-click a team, select Manage team, and then select the Settings tab. For these activities, the name of the setting that was changed is displayed in the Item column in the audit log search results.
A user changed a sensitivity label on a Teams meeting.
A Teams chat was created.
A user creates a team.
A message in a chat or channel was deleted.
Deleted all organization apps from the catalog.
An app has been deleted from the catalog.
A user deletes a channel from a team.
A team owner deletes a team.
An external message sender is detected to have potential impersonation activity.

Friendly name: Edited a message with a URL link in Teams
Description: A user edits a message and adds a URL link to it in Teams.
Chat or channel messages were exported.
Chat recordings were exported.
Chat transcripts were exported.

Friendly name: Failed to validate invitation to shared channel 3
Description: A user responds to an invitation to a shared channel but the invitation failed validation.
A Microsoft Teams chat was retrieved.

Friendly name: Fetched all hosted content of a message1
Description: All hosted content in  a message, such as images or code snippets, was retrieved.
An app was installed.

A user took action on an adaptive card within a chat. Adaptive cards are typically used by bots to allow the rich display of information and interaction in chats. Note: Only inline input actions on an adaptive card inside a chat are available in the audit log. For example, when a user submits a poll response in a channel conversation on an adaptive card generated by a Poll bot. User actions such as "View result", which will open a dialog, or user actions inside dialogs won't be available in the audit log.
A new message was posted to a chat or channel.
AI-generated notes have been populated for a group chat.

Friendly name: Populate AI-generated notes in live meetings
Description: AI-generated notes have been populated for a live meeting.
An app was added to the catalog.
A message of a chat or channel was retrieved.

Friendly name: Read hosted content of a message 1
Description: Hosted content in a message, such as an image or a code snippet, was retrieved.
A user removes a bot from a team.
A user removes a connector from a channel.
A team owner removes members from a team, channel, or group chat.
A user removed a sensitivity label from a Teams meeting.
A team or channel owner disabled sharing for a shared channel.
A team or channel owner re-enabled sharing for a shared channel.
A user removes a tab from a channel.

Friendly name: Responded to invitation for shared channel 3
Description: A user responded to a shared channel invitation.

Friendly name: Responded to invitee response to shared channel 3
Description: A channel owner responded to a response from a user who responded to a shared channel invitation.
Messages from a chat or channel were retrieved.

Friendly name: Sent a message with a URL link in Teams
Description: A user sends a message containing a URL link in Teams.

Friendly name: Sent change notification for message creation 1
Description: A change notification was sent to notify a subscribed listener application of a new message.

Friendly name: Sent change notification for message deletion 1
Description: A change notification was sent to notify a subscribed listener application of a deleted message.

Friendly name: Sent change notification for message update 1
Description: A change notification was sent to notify a subscribed listener application of an updated message.

A channel owner or member sends an invitation to a shared channel. Invitations to shared channels can be sent to people outside of your organization if the channel policy is configured to share the channel with external users.
A subscription was created by a listener application to receive change notifications for messages.
An app was uninstalled.
An app was updated in the catalog.
A Teams chat was updated.
A message of a chat or channel was updated.
A user modified a connector in a channel.
A user modified a tab in a channel.
An app was upgraded to its latest version in the catalog.
A user signs in to a Microsoft Teams client. This event doesn't capture token refresh activities.
A new message was posted to a chat or a channel.

A user successfully adds a new scheduling group to the schedule.
A user successfully edits a scheduling group.
A user successfully deletes a scheduling group from the schedule.
A user successfully withdraws a published schedule.
A user successfully adds a shift.

A user successfully edits time off.
A user successfully deletes time off.
A user successfully adds an open shift to a scheduling group.
A user successfully edits an open shift in a scheduling group.
A user successfully deletes an open shift from a scheduling group.
A user successfully shared a team schedule for a date range.
A user successfully clocks in using Time clock.
A user successfully clocks out using Time clock.
A user successfully starts a break during an active Time clock session.
A user successfully ends a break during an active Time clock session.
A user successfully adds a new manual Time clock entry on Time Sheet.
A user successfully edits a Time clock entry on Time Sheet.
A user successfully deletes a Time clock entry on Time Sheet.
A user added a shift request.
A user responded to a shift request.
A user canceled a shift request.
A user changes a setting in Shifts settings.
The Shifts app is integrated with a third-party system.
A user acknowledges the off-shift message to access Teams after shift hours.

A user opens the request editing workflow and selects Save to confirm and save any changes, or enables or disables the update request directly.

Description: A user views the details of the update.

Accepted sharing link for a folder.

Description
An admin or user deleted an email message that was deemed to be harmful.
An admin denial for a release request from a user for an email message that was deemed to be harmful.
An admin or user exported an email message that was deemed to be harmful.
An admin or user previewed an email message that was deemed to be harmful.
An admin or user released an email message from quarantine that was deemed to be harmful.
